185473504.review:
One major reason why Feed and Grow: Fish can be considered a bad game is due to its lack of ongoing development and content updates, which has led to a stagnant and repetitive gameplay experience. While the game initially attracted players with its unique concept of controlling a fish in an open underwater environment and evolving by eating other creatures, it quickly becomes apparent that the game lacks depth and long-term engagement. The gameplay loop is simplistic—eat smaller fish, grow bigger, and eat larger fish—but this cycle becomes monotonous because there are few objectives, challenges, or variety to keep players interested over time.
Moreover, the game suffers from noticeable technical issues that detract from the overall experience. Players frequently report bugs, glitches, and performance problems such as frame rate drops, poor optimization, and unstable controls. These issues can make the game frustrating to play, especially when combined with clunky mechanics and unpolished animations. Despite being in early access for years, the developers have been slow to release meaningful updates or improvements, leaving many of these problems unresolved.
Additionally, the multiplayer mode, which could have added significant replay value, feels underdeveloped and lacks proper balancing. The limited variety of maps, fish species, and game modes contributes to the sense that the game is incomplete. This lack of content, combined with slow development progress, leads players to feel as though the game is more of a tech demo than a fully realized experience.
The graphics, while appealing at first glance, also suffer from inconsistencies. Some models and environments appear detailed, while others feel rushed or poorly designed. Sound design is minimal and repetitive, failing to create an immersive underwater atmosphere. Without engaging sound effects or dynamic music, the game struggles to build an exciting or tense environment, further diminishing the overall gameplay experience.
In summary, Feed and Grow: Fish has an interesting concept but fails to deliver a polished, engaging, and content-rich experience. The combination of repetitive gameplay, technical issues, lack of updates, and underdeveloped features makes the game feel incomplete and frustrating for many players.

185160844.review:
Simply put, this game is unplayable. I hate to say that but, it's very true. I wanted to like this game. It's very much the sort of game I could see myself putting a lot of hours into. But, after 72 minutes of trying to complete just ONE level, it was impossible.

Your view is constantly off center and blocked by your own body. Biting another fish and being able to continue biting it is a matter of pure luck. Enemies blind side you constantly. So, it's pretty common to spend a good 10 to 20 minutes playing only to suddenly die and have to start over. You could just stay in the shallows where they can't get you but, the tiny critters provide so little food that you WILL starve. Probably while trying to bite another fish to death.

I only bought this game because I liked what I saw while watching DangerouslyFunny play it on YouTube. But it seems like the game has drastically changed since he was playing and, there's been no updates from the developers since 2021. Still in early access so, it seems like the game is well and truly abandoned.

The devs couldn't even decide what the actual name is. The Steam page say Feed and Grow: Fish but the game itself says Fish: Feed and Grow. This is NOT worth the $15 asking price. If I were making this game I'd be extremely embarrassed by it. It's really a shame because the premise is great. But, don't waste your time or your money. I'm refunding now as I don't need the raise in blood pressure.

184846537.review:
o jogo é ótimo, o acompanhei desde a muito tempo,  ele sempre foi bom, sempre teve futuro, peixes um melhores que os outros, viciante, divertidinho, e, apesar de ser meio enjoativo depois de um tempo mas vc pode fazer desafios a vc mesmo, além disso vc sempre acaba o visitando de novo, seja para relembrar ou jogar mesmo, porém, ele foi abandonado, algo extremamente triste, facilmente poderia ser um jogo de sucesso, o modo survival era o que mais me atraia, é um baita vacilo eles não terem nem terminado o ultimo modo de survival (e ainda abandonar o antigo), para depois o abandonar, e continua assim desde 2021, eu ficaria MUITO feliz se eles continuassem o jogo, mesmo se fosse para colocar coisinhas aqui e ali, eu espero que isso aconteça, mas é improvável.

alias,  o modo online que se eu não me engano foi prometido, é um cocozinho (pra n falar q n funciona), eu tenho a impressão que eles, depois de um tempo deixaram de botar fé no jogo.
ele não é AQUELES jogos, mas tinha futuro, ele é aqueles típicos jogos desconhecidos, leves, abandonados, mas bons.

se vc esta procurando um jogo meio estilo "arcade", onde vc só cresce e acumula pontos e tenta ser o mais forte, esse jogo é um bom desses, embora, mesmo assim a melhores.

184488741.review:
Small fish eats star fish. Small fish level up. Small fish eat slightly bigger small fish. Small fish does this repeatedly until small fish becomes too cocky and goes after medium fish. Small fish dies. Small fish re-dos this, making sure to not be cocky. Small fish dies by massive monster fish for no fucking reason. Small fish re-dos these steps, making sure to not be cocky and stay in the safe shallows. Small fish dies via glitch. Small fish re-dos these steps, making sure to not be cocky, staying in the safe shallows, and begging to the gods for that glitch to not happen again. Luckly. Small fish becomes medium fish! Then the medium fish dies by a smaller, yet somehow stronger fish. Small fish re-dos these steps, making sure to not be cocky, staying in the safe shallows, begging to the gods for that glitch to not happen again, and only eating the knowingly weak fish. Small fish turns into medium fish after doing these steps. After many close calls and time. Medium fish turns into large fish! With renewed confidence, large fish goes after massive monster fish. Large fish stood no fucking chance and died in the fist 10 seconds. Small fish re-dos these steps, making sure to not be cocky, staying in the safe shallows, begging to the gods for that glitch to not happen again, only eating the knowingly weak fish, and to NOT go after the massive monster fish once its large fish. After a almost embarrassingly long time, small fish goes from medium fish, to large fish! Large fish knows they are a large fish, and knows its cans and cants. After what seems like years. Large fish turns into monster fish! Then, monster fish goes after massive monster fish. And wins! The amount of food makes the monster fish into a massive monster fish! Yippy! Now, massive monster fish will spawn camp the massive monster fish and eat its meat! After about 30 minuets massive monster fish realizes with all this power, it makes the game boring as hell.


Massive monster fish goes back into small fish. Doing this process over again as small fish irl has god awful memory.






For real. This game is a 5.5/10. Even though it was mostly abandoned (I say mostly, as there are rumors in the discussions about the reason for it being "abandoned" even though nothing official has come out). 


And with the large number of bugs, some people can't even start the game. Not to mention the nearly non-existent UI, you have to move the mouse around like a game of hide and seek to find any button. The game IS fun, but gets boring fairly fast. I only came back after many months to make a review.
